section:
&reftitle.constants;
These styles are used by the numfmt_create to define the type of the formatter.
The possible number format styles.
Type Name Description
integer PATTERN_DECIMAL Decimal format defined by pattern
integer DECIMAL Decimal format
integer CURRENCY Currency format
integer PERCENT Percent format
integer SCIENTIFIC Scientific format
integer SPELLOUT Spellout rule-based format
integer ORDINAL Ordinal rule-based format
integer DURATION Duration rule-based format
integer PATTERN_RULEBASED Rule-based format defined by pattern
integer DEFAULT Default format for the locale
integer IGNORE Alias for PATTERN_DECIMAL
These constants define how the numbers are parsed or formatted. They should be used as arguments to numfmt_format and numfmt_parse.
Number parsing types
Type Name Description
integer TYPE_DEFAULT Derive the type from variable type
integer TYPE_INT32 Format/parse as 32-bit integer
integer TYPE_INT64 Format/parse as 64-bit integer
integer TYPE_DOUBLE Format/parse as floating point value
integer TYPE_CURRENCY Format/parse as currency value
Number format attribute used by numfmt_get_attribute and numfmt_set_attribute.
The possible formatter numeric attributes.
Type Name Description
integer PARSE_INT_ONLY Parse integers only.
integer GROUPING_USED Use grouping separator.
integer DECIMAL_ALWAYS_SHOWN Always show decimal point.
integer MAX_INTEGER_DIGITS Maximum integer digits.
integer MIN_INTEGER_DIGITS Minimum integer digits.
integer INTEGER_DIGITS Integer digits.
integer MAX_FRACTION_DIGITS Maximum fraction digits.
integer MIN_FRACTION_DIGITS Minimum fraction digits.
integer FRACTION_DIGITS Fraction digits.
integer MULTIPLIER Multiplier.
integer GROUPING_SIZE Grouping size.
integer ROUNDING_MODE Rounding Mode.
integer ROUNDING_INCREMENT Rounding increment.
integer FORMAT_WIDTH The width to which the output of format() is padded.
integer PADDING_POSITION The position at which padding will take place. See pad position constants for possible argument values.
integer SECONDARY_GROUPING_SIZE Secondary grouping size.
integer SIGNIFICANT_DIGITS_USED Use significant digits.
integer MIN_SIGNIFICANT_DIGITS Minimum significant digits.
integer MAX_SIGNIFICANT_DIGITS Maximum significant digits.
integer LENIENT_PARSE Lenient parse mode used by rule-based formats.
Number format text attribute used by numfmt_get_text_attribute and numfmt_set_text_attribute.
The possible formatter text attributes.
Type Name Description
integer POSITIVE_PREFIX Positive prefix.
integer POSITIVE_SUFFIX Positive suffix.
integer NEGATIVE_PREFIX Negative prefix.
integer NEGATIVE_SUFFIX Negative suffix.
integer PADDING_CHARACTER The character used to pad to the format width.
integer CURRENCY_CODE The ISO currency code.
integer DEFAULT_RULESET The default rule set. This is only available with rule-based formatters.
integer PUBLIC_RULESETS The public rule sets. This is only available with rule-based formatters. This is a read-only attribute. The public rulesets are returned as a single string, with each ruleset name delimited by ';' (semicolon).
Number format symbols used by numfmt_get_symbol and numfmt_set_symbol.
Constants for specifying a number format symbol.
Type Name Description
integer DECIMAL_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL The decimal separator.
integer GROUPING_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL The grouping separator.
integer PATTERN_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL The pattern separator.
integer PERCENT_SYMBOL The percent sign.
integer ZERO_DIGIT_SYMBOL Zero.
integer DIGIT_SYMBOL Character representing a digit in the pattern.
integer MINUS_SIGN_SYMBOL The minus sign.
integer PLUS_SIGN_SYMBOL The plus sign.
integer CURRENCY_SYMBOL The currency symbol.
integer INTL_CURRENCY_SYMBOL The international currency symbol.
integer MONETARY_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL The monetary separator.
integer EXPONENTIAL_SYMBOL The exponential symbol.
integer PERMILL_SYMBOL Per mill symbol.
integer PAD_ESCAPE_SYMBOL Escape padding character.
integer INFINITY_SYMBOL Infinity symbol.
integer NAN_SYMBOL Not-a-number symbol.
integer SIGNIFICANT_DIGIT_SYMBOL Significant digit symbol.
integer MONETARY_GROUPING_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL The monetary grouping separator.
Rounding mode values used by numfmt_get_attribute and numfmt_set_attribute with NumberFormatter::ROUNDING_MODE attribute.
The possible number format styles.
Type Name Description
integer ROUND_CEILING Rounding mode to round towards positive infinity.
integer ROUND_DOWN Rounding mode to round towards zero.
integer ROUND_FLOOR Rounding mode to round towards negative infinity.
integer ROUND_HALFDOWN Rounding mode to round towards "nearest neighbor" unless both neighbors are equidistant, in which case round down.
integer ROUND_HALFEVEN Rounding mode to round towards the "nearest neighbor" unless both neighbors are equidistant, in which case, round towards the even neighbor.
integer ROUND_HALFUP Rounding mode to round towards "nearest neighbor" unless both neighbors are equidistant, in which case round up.
integer ROUND_UP Rounding mode to round away from zero.
Pad position values used by numfmt_get_attribute and numfmt_set_attribute with NumberFormatter::PADDING_POSITION attribute.
The possible number format pad positions.
Type Name Description
integer PAD_AFTER_PREFIX Pad characters inserted after the prefix.
integer PAD_AFTER_SUFFIX Pad characters inserted after the suffix.
integer PAD_BEFORE_PREFIX Pad characters inserted before the prefix.
integer PAD_BEFORE_SUFFIX Pad characters inserted before the suffix.
